apiOperation.shortdesc: Create an instance of a mapped IMediator This will instantiate and register a Mediator for a given View Component.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The IMediator

apiParam.apiDesc: An instance of the view Class previously mapped to an IMediator Class

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Create an instance of a mapped IMediator
This will instantiate and register a Mediator for a given View Component. Mediator dependencies will be automatically resolved.

apiReturn.apiDesc: Whether this view class has been mapped

apiOperation.shortdesc: Map an IMediator to a view Class

apiParam.apiDesc: The concrete view Class or Fully Qualified Class Name
The explicit view Interface or Class that the mediator depends on OR an Array of such Interfaces/Classes.
Automatically construct and register an instance of Class mediatorClass when an instance of Class viewClass is detected
Automatically remove an instance of Class mediatorClass when its viewClass leaves the ancestory of the context view

apiOperation.shortdesc: Create or retrieve an instance of the given class

apiReturn.apiDesc: An instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Create or retrieve an instance of the given class

apiOperation.shortdesc: Does a rule exist to satsify such a request?

apiReturn.apiDesc: Whether such a mapping exists

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc: Does a rule exist to satsify such a request?

apiOperation.shortdesc: Perform an injection into an object, satisfying all it's dependencies The IInjector should throw an Error if it can't satisfy all dependencies of the injectee.

apiParam.apiDesc: The object to inject into - the Injectee

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Perform an injection into an object, satisfying all it's dependencies
The IInjector should throw an Error if it can't satisfy all dependencies of the injectee.

apiOperation.shortdesc:
Create an object of the given class, supplying its dependencies as constructor parameters if the used DI solution has support for constructor injection Adapters for DI solutions that don't support constructor injection should just create a new instance and perform setter and/ or method injection on that.
NOTE: This method will always create a new instance.

apiReturn.apiDesc: The created instance

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
Create an object of the given class, supplying its dependencies as constructor parameters if the used DI solution has support for constructor injection
Adapters for DI solutions that don't support constructor injection should just create a new instance and perform setter and/ or method injection on that.
NOTE: This method will always create a new instance. If you need to retrieve an instance consider using getInstance
The IInjector should throw an Error if it can't satisfy all dependencies of the injectee.

apiOperation.shortdesc: When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject a new instance of instantiateClass.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject a new instance of instantiateClass.
This will create a new instance for each injection.

apiOperation.shortdesc: When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor use rule useRule to determine the correct injection.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

apiParam.apiDesc: The rule to use for the injection

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor use rule useRule to determine the correct injection.
This will use whatever injection is set by the given injection rule as created using one of the other mapping methods.

apiOperation.shortdesc: When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of useSingletonOf.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of useSingletonOf.
This will create an instance on the first injection, but will re-use that instance for subsequent injections.

apiOperation.shortdesc: When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of whenAskedFor.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject an instance of whenAskedFor.
This will create an instance on the first injection, but will re-use that instance for subsequent injections.

apiOperation.shortdesc: When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject the instance useValue.

apiReturn.apiDesc: A reference to the rule for this injection. To be used with mapRule

apiOperationDetail.apiDesc:
When asked for an instance of the class whenAskedFor inject the instance useValue.
This is used to register an existing instance with the injector and treat it like a Singleton.

adobeApiEventDetail.apiDesc: Dispatched at the end of the startup() method's execution. This is often used to trigger startup/bootstrapping commands by wiring them to this event and calling super.startup() in the last line of your startup() override.

adobeApiEvent.shortdesc: Dispatched at the end of the startup() method's execution.

Abstract Context Implementation
Extend this class to create a Framework or Application context
